results.title: Wombats
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
A program in which the two main species of wombat - the Common Wombat and the Hairy-Nosed Wombat, are compared. Also included is a reconstruction of the fascinating research done by a 15 year old schoolboy, in the 1960’s, who was the first person to venture into the long tunnels that the wombats dig as homes.

results.title: Wombat tale
results.creator_credit: Robbie Sands and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
An interactive animation on CD-ROM set in 1953 which tells the story of four wombats who dig their way to Russia in search of tomatoes. The user plays the part of a Russian farmer whose farm becomes a haven for four idealist wombats.
In Russian with English subtitles

results.title: Woman sesame oil maker [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Tianjin Film Studio, Changchun Film Studio and Xie Fei
results.brief_description: A successful career woman, the manager of a Chinese-Japanese joint venture sesame oil factory, seeks comfort from the stress of her business, a violent, alcoholic husband, and a mentally retarded son in the arms of a married man. When the young girl she has arranged to marry her son discovers her affair, she responds with sympathy to her future mother-in-law’s problems. A surprisingly close relationship develops between the two women as they struggle together against tradition and circumstance to take control of their lives. Cast includes Siqin Gaowa, Wu Yujuan, Lei Kesheng and Chen Baoguo. The film won the Golden Bear and Film Critic awards at the 43rd Berlin Film Festival 1993. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Woman is
results.brief_description: Uses a series of photographic stills in order to illustrate the history and character of the roles that women occupy in society. Stresses the contrast and individuality of the people within each role. The film is composed of approximately four hundred separate images of women collected from drawings, paintings and photographs. Music and sound effects compliment the quotes and comments about the situation of women throughout history.

results.title: Woman as a flower = La Femme fleur
results.brief_description: Based on the drawings and etchings of Aubrey Beardsley, Gustav Klimt, Max Klinger and other artists living about the turn of the century. This film is a tribute to the women of the Edwardian era, and gives a fascinating glimpse of that time. Also of interest as a study of the Art Nouveau, which expressed the prosperity of the period.

results.title: Woman's estate
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Review: 28th year”.
1975 is International Women’s Year. The Equal Pay Act and the Sex Discrimination Bill mark a new milestone in the emancipation of women. Includes historical b&w archival footage.

results.title: Wolves of the sea
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society, TBS Productions, David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook
results.brief_description: Killer whales are found in every ocean of the world - magnificent, highly intelligent animals that must kill to live. Each family pod has its own unique dialect, skills and traditions which are passed on through the generations. From British Columbia where they hunt down salmon, to Norway for the schools of herring, to the sub-Antarctic where the penguins and elephant seals are pursued relentlessly, and finally to Argentina where sea lion pups are picked off the beach, this outstanding video portrays the killer whales as they are - wolves of the sea. However it is presented with great empathy and understanding and is accompanied by some of the most stunning photography creating an absolute visual delight. Highly recommended family viewing. Narrated by David Attenborough.
